meanings.definition: A person or animal that is wandering or lagging behind a group.
meanings.sent1: The stragglers finally caught up with the rest of the hikers.
meanings.sent2: The teacher noticed a few stragglers still lingering in the hallway after the bell rang.
meanings.sent3: The stragglers in the race decided to take a detour through the park.
meanings.sent4: The stragglers of the flock were like lost sheep in the vast meadow.
meanings.sent5: The stragglers, tired and weary, trudged along the path, trying to keep up.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals that are dispersed or scattered.
meanings.sent1: The stragglers of the team were spread out across the field.
meanings.sent2: After the event, the stragglers slowly made their way out of the venue.
meanings.sent3: The stragglers of the party were still chatting in small groups.
meanings.sent4: The stragglers of leaves on the ground painted a colorful mosaic.
meanings.sent5: The stragglers, like scattered puzzle pieces, needed to come together for the full picture.
